segments.text: The water is pouring over the edge of the sink, and the woman doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she just keeps drying that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the water spreading across the floor, getting closer to the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool like he’s walking a tightrope.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is reaching up, her fingers just inches from the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a slow-motion disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on her task that she doesn’t even hear the stool creaking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever notice the water or the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so absurd that I almost want to laugh.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I realize how dangerous it really is.
segments.speaker: PAR
